Test Case: Landing Page matches composites
Precondition: Ensure screen resolution is 1280x720.
Steps:
1. Navigate to the initial landing page with Chrome 85+.
2. Compare the UI with Figma composites.
Expected Result: The appearance of the landing page matches the Figma composites.
Environment:
OS: Windows 10 Home
Browser: Google Chrome Ver. 138.0.7204.101 (64-bit)
Actual Result: Overlapping page elements after scrolling down. See screenshots.

Test Case: Order Page matches composites
Precondition:
Ensure screen resolution is 1280x720.
Navigate from the landing page to the Order page.
Steps:
1. Navigate to the order page with Chrome 85+.
2. Compare the UI with Figma composites.
Expected Result: The appearance of the order page matches the Figma composites.
Environment:
OS: Windows 10 Home
Browser: Google Chrome Ver. 138.0.7204.101 (64-bit)
Actual Result: Subway station field label is darker than it should be, per the composites.

Test Case: Field appearance matches composites
Precondition:
Ensure screen resolution is 1280x720.
Navigate from the landing page to the Order page.
Steps:
1. Find and evaluate the "First name" input field.
2. Compare the UI with Figma composites.
Expected Result: The appearance of the text field, in all states (blank, error, filled-out) match the Figma composites.
Environment:
OS: Windows 10 Home
Browser: Google Chrome Ver. 138.0.7204.101 (64-bit)

Test Case: Test the field with zero characters
Precondition:
Ensure screen resolution is 1280x720.
Navigate from the landing page to the Order page.
Steps:
1. Select the "First name" input field.
2. Enter no text input.
Expected Result: Should trigger a "Enter correct name" error.
Environment:
OS: Windows 10 Home
Browser: Google Chrome Ver. 138.0.7204.101 (64-bit)
Actual Result: Error message reads, "Enter a valid name".

Test Case: Test the field with a phone number containing symbols (other than +).
Precondition:
Ensure screen resolution is 1280x720.
Navigate from the landing page to the Order page.
Steps:
1. Select the "Phone" input field.
2. Enter text input.
Expected Result: Should trigger a "Enter a valid phone number" error.
Environment:
OS: Windows 10 Home
Browser: Google Chrome Ver. 138.0.7204.101 (64-bit)
Actual Result: Error message reads, "Enter a valid number"
